issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify addGuestStudents(int, String): void (an int plus a String reason) but the solution implements addGuestStudents with only a single int parameter. This parameter mismatch means the reference solution does not match the API students are asked to implement (and the UML), which is confusing and could lead students to implement a different signature than the provided solution or tests expect.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's addGuestStudents method match the specification/UML by adding the String parameter: change its signature to addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason) and update the implementation to increment numberOfGuestStudents accordingly (and optionally record or log the reason). Alternatively, if the intent was to omit the reason, update the problem statement and UML to reflect addGuestStudents(int): void so all artifacts are consistent.

issues.description: The problem statement (and UML) specify a method addGuestStudents(int, String) that accepts a number of new guest students plus a String reason. The solution implements addGuestStudents(int) with only an int parameter (no String reason). This mismatch in the method signature means the conceptual requirement "add guest students with a reason" is not represented the same way in the solution: students reading the problem will expect to implement or call a two-parameter method, while the provided solution exposes a one-parameter method. This creates a mapping confusion about whether the reason parameter is required and where it should be handled.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution's method signature match the problem statement by changing the solution to implement addGuestStudents(int numberOfNewGuestStudents, String reason). Update the method body to increment numberOfGuestStudents and (optionally) record/log the provided reason (or explicitly ignore it with a comment). Alternatively, if the reason parameter is intentionally unnecessary, update the problem statement and UML to specify addGuestStudents(int) only, so all artifacts share the same contract.
